bnf_parser.callables

Class MatchAnyRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • bnf_parser.callables.Callable
      • bnf_parser.callables.MatchAnyRule

  • public class MatchAnyRule
extends Callable
    This class checks whether or not any rule among a given set of rules matches from the current position in the file being parsed. If the maximum number of occurences is greater than 1, then this class will attempt to match as many rules from the subset as possible.
    Author:
    Hubert Lemelin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Rule[] rules
      The set of rules form which at least one rule must match.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MatchAnyRule

        public MatchAnyRule(int minOccurences,
                    int maxOccurences,
                    Rule... rules)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        minOccurences - The minimum number of occurences the pattern must appear. Can be 0.
        maxOccurences - The maximum number of occurences the pattern must appear. Can be 'infinity' (Integer.MAX_VALUE).
        rules - The set of rules to be matched.

        Checks if any of the given rule matches in the parser at the current file position.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        parser - The current instance of a parser implementign SubparserInterface.
        Returns:
        True if parsing succeeded, false otherwise.
